text:
Operating a mobile
core, sort of the brains of

any wireless network,
is very expensive, typically,

both in terms of
time and energy and money.

And we didn't want to go
down that same path if we
could figure out a way that would be

certainly more flexible,
more redundant and resilient,

and hopefully even
more affordable. And that

led us to working
with Working Group 2, WG2. And

they, years ago,
came up with this idea of

building a mobile core
that lived entirely in the cloud,

lives in AWS. We
were able to go from signing

on the dotted line
with them and having that

mobile core live and
in the cloud, I think it was

less than a week and
that's sort of insane timing

in our industry.
There's nothing compared to

the time-to-live that
you can get to. But also the

pace of innovation
that we see from AWS in terms

of new functionality,
new features, new services.

And by taking what
we are able to tap into with

WG2 and AWS and
extending that to our own customers,

they'll be able to
build and develop things

on our network and
our platform that we haven't

even thought of yet
and haven't even imagined

yet as well. And
that's pretty exciting for us.
